# TESS Program G04223

Title: Improved Characterization Of Exoplanet Pairs In Mean Motion Resonance From Transit Timing Variations.

PI: El Moutamid, Maryame - Cornell University

Type: SMALL

Summary: The provenance of sub-Neptune-sized planets is one of the greatest unresolved mysteries from the Kepler mission. Determination of the nature and origins of these exoplanets relies not only on measuring their radii, but also requires knowledge about their masses, atmospheric compositions, and interior structures. With additional observational data from TESS Cycle 4, we can more accurately estimate the planet mass distributions from measured radii, distinguish their compositions, and closely constrain the occurrence rate of super-Earth and sub-Neptune-sized exoplanets. Here, we propose to investigate the confirmed and candidate pairs of exoplanets (from Kepler and K2) orbiting their parent star in a near Mean Motion Resonances (MMRs).
